title: Split into Separate Packages
description:
Split into Separate Packages

**STATUS: DEFERRED - Using Optional Extras Instead**

## Decision

After evaluating monorepo vs submodules for production server deployment (Dec 2025), decided to **keep monorepo with optional extras** instead of package splitting.

## Rationale

**Pros of Monorepo:**
- ✅ Faster development velocity (change everything at once)
- ✅ Simpler versioning (one package version)
- ✅ Easier testing (test everything together)
- ✅ Simple CI/CD (one pipeline)
- ✅ Easier refactoring (no cross-package coordination)

**Cons of Splitting:**
- ❌ Complex version management (4 packages to sync)
- ❌ Integration testing harder
- ❌ Breaking changes across packages difficult
- ❌ Not needed yet (no evidence server usage >> CLI/TUI)

## Alternative: Optional Dependencies

Using pyproject.toml optional extras instead:

```bash
# Backend developers (minimal)
pip install consoul[server]  # ~60MB, FastAPI + SDK only

# CLI users
pip install consoul[cli]  # ~80MB, Click + Rich only

# TUI users  
pip install consoul[tui]  # ~150MB, Textual included

# Full installation
pip install consoul[all]  # Everything
```

## When to Reconsider

Split into separate packages IF:
1. Server usage >> CLI/TUI usage (different user bases)
2. Version sync becomes painful
3. Install size becomes real problem (not theoretical)
4. Community requests it

## Related Work

- EPIC-016: Production SDK Hardening (security, compliance)
- EPIC-017: Production Server Package (consoul.server module)
- EPIC-018: Legal Industry Template (deployment)

New epics focus on production readiness within monorepo, not package splitting.

**Tickets SOUL-260, 261, 262 closed as won't-do-now.**
